intro: Monvillea alticostata, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
